### addFieldExpander() {#aebe22953dd142bbeca6a5e946526e8ef}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SetTheory::addFieldExpander (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> ClassName, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> FieldName)</>}>
addFieldExpander - Add an expander for ClassName that simply evaluates FieldName in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/record">Record</a> to get the set elements.

That is all that is needed for a class like:

class Set&lt;dag d&gt; &#123; dag Elts = d; &#125;

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/settheory-h/#l00122">122</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/settheory-h">SetTheory.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/settheory-cpp/#l00278">278</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/settheory-cpp">SetTheory.cpp</a>.

### expand() {#a80f28e71e920f02b25534abf3c14d39d}

<MemberDefinition

expand - Expand a record into a set of elements if possible.

Return a pointer to the expanded elements, or NULL if Set cannot be expanded further.
